Sentencas: A series of borosilicate-based glasses, ternary BaO-SiO2-B2O3 and quaternary BaO-SiO2-B2O3-Al2O3 systems, are prepared as sealing materials for intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cells (IT-SOFCs).
Titulo: Synthesis and long-term test of borosilicate-based sealing glass for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The thermal expansion, crystalline phases, glass forming ability, and thermochemical stabilities of the glasses are characterized.
Titulo: Synthesis and long-term test of borosilicate-based sealing glass for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Additionally, the effect of the B2O3/SiO2 ratio and Al2O3 and BaO contents on the coefficient of thermal expansion (CTE) are discussed and compared.
Titulo: Synthesis and long-term test of borosilicate-based sealing glass for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Test results show that one glass (G6) can fully wet various substrates at the scaling temperature of 1000 degrees C and match thermal expansion.
Titulo: Synthesis and long-term test of borosilicate-based sealing glass for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Possible interfacial reactions between the glass and those cell components aging up to 5000h are investigated by clement mapping, XRD, SEM, and EPMA.
Titulo: Synthesis and long-term test of borosilicate-based sealing glass for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Leakage testing was also performed at temperatures up to 650 degrees C.
Titulo: Synthesis and long-term test of borosilicate-based sealing glass for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The results show that the glass (G6) remains amorphous after 5000 h test and is stable under these conditions and compatible with the other fuel cell components.
Titulo: Synthesis and long-term test of borosilicate-based sealing glass for solid oxide fuel cells
